description.raw:
This is a continuation of pull request #2619, sorry still getting used to bitbucket.. I made a branch to continue the PR since I had made the change on "default", and it seems I can't change the origin branch of the PR so I had to create a new one.

Ok, this commit reverts the removal of "qwt" and replaces it with an explicit check of the dependencies of QWT_LIBRARY.  This means that it will use tools like "ldd" on Linux and "otool" on Mac (through CMake's GET_PREREQUISITES macro) and check them for the string Qt5Gui.  If it's not found an error is issued.  If the variable QWT_DEPENDENCIES is empty, i.e. GET_PREREQUESITES did not work properly, the check is skipped.  Tested only on Xenial, but I think this is more robust than checking the library name on certain operating systems.

* Remove plain 'qwt' leaving only 'qwt-qt5', since it links to Qt4 version.

    Fixes a segfault on start-up if the wrong qwt was selected.

* Explicitly check dependencies of qwt for Qt5

Ok, this commit reverts the removal of "qwt" and replaces it with an explicit check of the dependencies of QWT_LIBRARY. This means that it will use tools like "ldd" on Linux and "otool" on Mac (through CMake's GET_PREREQUISITES macro) and check them for the string Qt5Gui. If it's not found an error is issued. If the variable QWT_DEPENDENCIES is empty, i.e. GET_PREREQUESITES did not work properly, the check is skipped. Tested only on Xenial, but I think this is more robust than checking the library name on certain operating systems.

  • Remove plain 'qwt' leaving only 'qwt-qt5', since it links to Qt4 version.

    Fixes a segfault on start-up if the wrong qwt was selected.

  • Explicitly check dependencies of qwt for Qt5

title: Prefer qwt qt5 linux
